page.title: 06 St.Crispin Hospital,Duston
page.content:
Most patients do occupational therapy of some sort to keep their minds active. They have pleasant recreation rooms with video and T.V. screens and where they can prepare snacks. There is a large theatre for concerts and frequent outings are organised.
All meals are cooked in the hospital which has its own Bakery and Butchery (it supplies all the hospitals in Northants and Oxfordshire). There is a three choice menu which is planned monthly. The food is taken to the wards in heated trolleys so that mealtimes can be fairly flexible.
